title: Will we see mid becoming duo lane after all these changes?
body:
Wouldn't it be better for adc and supp to go mid now and current midlaners to transfer to bot lane?
--- Previously adc and supp went bot because they were supposed to have dragon control (there was nothing on top untill Baron spawned) and assasins went mid to roam on either top or bot. Now dragon is not the only objective to care about, there is also Herold.  Adc and support could have easy acces to both of them. 
--- They wouldn't have problems with warding both sides of river in case of enemy gank.
--- They could have easly take turret on the shortest lane.
--- Currently supports roam just as much. Being on midlane thay could also help toplaner.
--- Current midlaners doesn't really roam to top as often as they used to. Thay usually go bot, so transfering them to botlane wouldn't change much, right?
--- After recent jungle experience changes we see some midlaners taking Smite. Being on bot it wouldn't be as effective as Crab is now spawning randomly. So it would be up to jungler if he wants to give Scuttle to one of his laners.

replies.body: They still go bot lane because of bot towers early debuff.  Having two people attack one weak tower is faster than one champion attacking it.

There's also the fact that both ADC and supp can kind of work off of and with each other to get out of a gank. Mid laners don't have that option, and not too many of them have the tools to get out of a gank in a long lane. Thus mid lane is safest for them due to how short it is.

Finally, mid lane, because it is the shortest lane, it is the lane where minions appear the fastest.

Because mid laners are level dependent, they need minions to come as fast as possible so they can get as much farm as possible and get levels faster.

Top laners tend to be level dependent too, but top laners generally can compensate for this with other aspects (for example, many of them can build tanky).

most mids can waveclear effectively and safely though.  So unlike most adcs who can get pushed under tower, a mage could clear the wave from a distance and keep the enemy from damaging the turret.

As mentioned previously, this wouldn't be in favour of midlaners. Mages need the safety of their turret because trades result in, well, getting bursted. Immobile mages wouldn't have anywhere to fall back to on the sidelanes. Midlane is more of a standstill while optimising gold from kills or csing. The sidelanes you can push to tower and attack it because it is safer, it's dangerous to do that in midlane because of the gank points. So that wouldn't be optimal for the adc support set up. Also mid tower falling first creates a huge advantage or disadvantage to map pressure.

Also when you're bot and you push the wave out, there is time to take dragon without worrying about the wave pushing to tower. Mid is a lot shorter, there really isn't time to roam from mid to take dragon especially because an AD champion can last hit more easily to shove the wave when you leave. Having the adc to take dragon is more optimal than a mage or assassin because of their dps. So it wouldn't be better for a mage or assassin to leave bot and help with dragon, that would also take a long time compared to if an adc support came to take dragon.

Even though these kind of changes can bring some excitement back, I don't think it's viable. Currently, since the bottom lane tower has no shield up compared to the others, that's where the duo lane will go. A good bottom lane can take half the tower before 5 minutes, which can't happen in any other lane. 

Also, most mages can't play side lanes. The lane is way too big, and any gank attempt will probably lead to them dying, because the tower is far away from the middle of the lane. At the same time, mid is a short lane, which favors short bursty trades, which mages and assassins want. ADCs and Supports want to take advantage of certain situations that lead to extended trades, but having the safety of the tower to fall back on means there won't be much trading going on.

Another thing that will probably negatively impact games is that mid tower going down first means that the map opens up way too much, and now the winning team has more options. Mid tower is important for many things in the game. Losing it means you have less control over the river, less controls over the raptors as well. Therefore, by having duos in a mid lane means that chances are mid tower will be taken first, and the snowball will be even harder, which is something I wouldn't like to happen.

I think the reason it's still two people bot, is because dragon spawns before 10 minutes. Meta is usually about shoving out the lane and getting tower down, and then rotate to toplane and top to bottom. The ideal play is to have toplane tp to botlane for a clean gank after shoving their lane, and then take bot tower + drake. After that, adc and support recall and go top, while top goes botlane.
If bot is mid, they can still assist on dragon/contest dragon (and herald too) better, the support roams faster to side lanes, and they're going to be much safer mid because of how short the lane is

I don't think so, mages go mid because it gives them the fastest and safest access to levels. Having them bot results in them being extremely unsafe in lane and messing up / being outplayed in lane management will result in the lane being frozen against them and being unable to walk up and break the freeze without dying to the enemy jungle and the lane opponent. 

It's also going to be much more deifcult to leverage advantages for the duo lane as dives are far harder to pull off midlane due to the close proximity of the secondary tower. Plus supports would gain levels relatively faster and thus making the lane safer. (level 5 vs other lanes 6 instead of 4) the benefits wouldn't be strong enough I don't think.
